messages.subject: Re: Holt WAS :How is Waldorf education controlling?
messages.msgSnippet: Anarchist!  I never considered that. :) It doesn t matter to me though.  I knew unschooling worked before I read anything he wrote because I grew up that way
messages.messageBody:
Anarchist! I never considered that. :) It doesn't matter to me
though. I knew unschooling worked before I read anything he wrote
because I grew up that way despite 13 1/2 years of government
school. He just put a name to it, broadened my horizons a bit and
created a support network. For that I'm thankful, politics aside.

Holly
2 COOL 4 SCHOOL
Unschooling t-shirts and more!
http://www.cafepress.com/2cool4school

--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, kbcdlovejo@a... wrote:
> In a message dated 8/9/2004 9:17:08 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
> unschooler@s... writes:
>
> It's like people telling me they don't
> believe in unschooling because they think Holt was a socialist.<<<<
>
> I thought he was an anarchist!
>
> Maybe I read too much into it. Maybe I *wanted* him to be an
anarchist! <G>
>
> ~Kelly
>
>
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Holt WAS :How is Waldorf education controlling?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/9/2004 9:17:08 AM Eastern Daylight Time, unschooler@swbell.net writes: It s  like people telling me they don t believe in unschooling
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/9/2004 9:17:08 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
unschooler@... writes:

It's like people telling me they don't
believe in unschooling because they think Holt was a socialist.<<<<

I thought he was an anarchist!

Maybe I read too much into it. Maybe I *wanted* him to be an anarchist! <G>

~Kelly
